greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Write n>=1 as either n=2^k-2^r with 0 <= r <= k-1, in which case a(2^k-2^r)=(k-r)*(k-r+1)/2, or as n=2^k-2^r+j with 2 <= r <= k-1, 1 <= j < 2^r-1, in which case a(2^k-2^r+j)=(k-r)*(k-r+1)*a(j).
comment: See A245196 for a list of other sequences produced by this type of recurrence.
It follows from the definition that the final entries in the blocks are triangular numbers.
maple: f:=proc(n) option remember; global m,G; local k,r,j,np;
if np=1 then r:=0; j:=0; else r:=1+floor(log[2](np-1)); j:=2^r-np; fi;
if j=0 then G[k-r]; else m*G[k-r]*f(j); fi;
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 27 2014
